title: Learning Design in Emergency Remote Education: An Educational Ethnographic Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners, as general citizens with beginner-level expertise in social studies, perform project-based learning in a digital-device-provided environment. Evaluation focuses on summative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize three contextually appropriate learning design strategies in emergency remote education environments.
Learners can propose practical solutions to overcome technical constraints that may arise when utilizing digital tools.
Learners can design remote educational materials that enhance learner engagement through Project-Based Learning (PBL).

resources: Online Collaboration Platform (e.g., Google Classroom, Zoom)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
